memberdef.definition: bool(* handler) (const std::any &context, HTTPRequest *req, const std::string &strReq)
memberdef.name: handler
uri_prefixes
memberdef.initializer: = { {"/rest/tx/", rest_tx}, {"/rest/block/notxdetails/", rest_block_notxdetails}, {"/rest/block/", rest_block_extended}, {"/rest/blockpart/", rest_block_part}, {"/rest/blockfilter/", rest_block_filter}, {"/rest/blockfilterheaders/", rest_filter_header}, {"/rest/chaininfo", rest_chaininfo}, {"/rest/mempool/", rest_mempool}, {"/rest/headers/", rest_headers}, {"/rest/getutxos", rest_getutxos}, {"/rest/deploymentinfo/", rest_deploymentinfo}, {"/rest/deploymentinfo", rest_deploymentinfo}, {"/rest/blockhashbyheight/", rest_blockhash_by_height}, {"/rest/spenttxouts/", rest_spent_txouts}, }

parameterdescription.para: The HTTP request, whose status code will be set if node context is not found.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the node context or nullptr if not found.

parameterdescription.para: The HTTP request, whose status code will be set if node context mempool is not found.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the mempool or nullptr if no mempool found.

parameterdescription.para: The HTTP request, whose status code will be set if node context chainstatemanager is not found.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the chainstatemanager or nullptr if none found.

detaileddescription.para: Parse a URI to get the data format and URI without data format and query string.

parameterdescription.para: The strReq without the data format string and without the query string (if any).

simplesect.para: RESTResponseFormat that was parsed from the URI.

detaileddescription.para: Serialize spent outputs as a list of per-transaction CTxOut lists using binary format.
Serialize spent outputs as a list of per-transaction CTxOut lists using JSON format.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::any &context, HTTPRequest *req, const std::string &uri_part, std::optional< TxVerbosity > tx_verbosity, std::optional< std::pair< size_t, size_t > > block_part=std::nullopt)
memberdef.name: rest_block

detaileddescription.para:
This handler is used by multiple HTTP endpoints:
/block/ via rest_block_extended()
/block/notxdetails/ via rest_block_notxdetails()
/blockpart/ via rest_block_part() (doesn't support JSON response, so tx_verbosity is unset)
Start HTTP REST subsystem. Precondition; HTTP and RPC has been started.
Stop HTTP REST subsystem. Precondition; HTTP and RPC has been stopped.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CBlockIndex *const block_index, const CTxMemPool *const mempool, const Txid &hash, const BlockManager &blockman, uint256 &hashBlock)
memberdef.name: GetTransaction

detaileddescription.para: Return transaction with a given hash. If mempool is provided and block_index is not provided, check it first for the tx. If -txindex is available, check it next for the tx. Finally, if block_index is provided, check for tx by reading entire block from disk.

parameterdescription.para: The block to read from disk, or nullptr
If provided, check mempool for tx
Used to access and read blocks from disk
The block hash, if the tx was found via -txindex or block_index

simplesect.para: The tx if found, otherwise nullptr
